intro: Phyllostegia hiati, commonly known as the Hawaiian stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Phyllostegia hiati plays a role in the ecological dynamics of Hawaiian ecosystems, though it is sometimes considered an invasive species in other regions.
